subdisciplines.name: Behavioral finance
subdisciplines.description: The study of the influence of psychology on the behavior of financial practitioners and the subsequent effect on markets.

subdisciplines.name: Corporate finance
subdisciplines.description: The study of the financial decisions made by corporations, including investment, financing, and dividend decisions.

subdisciplines.name: Financial econometrics
subdisciplines.description: The application of statistical methods to financial data to test theories or validate models in financial economics.

subdisciplines.name: Financial engineering
subdisciplines.description: The application of mathematical techniques such as stochastic calculus, differential equations and computer simulations to financial problems.

subdisciplines.name: International finance
subdisciplines.description: The study of financial interactions among countries, including international trade, foreign direct investment, and international capital flows.

subdisciplines.name: Market microstructure
subdisciplines.description: The study of the process and outcomes of exchanging assets under fast-changing market conditions.

subdisciplines.name: Portfolio theory
subdisciplines.description: The study of how investors build diversified portfolios and allocate their wealth across different assets to maximize expected returns for a given level of risk.
